intro: Epacris impressa var. nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered epacris, is a species of flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its narrow, evergreen leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter and is admired for its fragrant blooms that appear in spring. This variety is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
